snippet: The common auction-house practice of granting anonymity to sellers could change, depending on the outcome of an appeal to be heard by a New York State court.
abstract: New York State Court will review ruling that could force state's auction industry to end longstanding practice of keeping sellers' names anonymous; many art-law experts say decision could change way auction business is conducted in New York State.
lead_paragraph: The common auction-house practice of granting anonymity to sellers could change, depending on the outcome of an appeal to be heard by a New York State court.

headline.seo: Battling to Keep Auction Sellers Anonymous
headline.main: Lawyers Fight to Keep Auction Sellers Anonymous
headline.print_headline: Lawyers Fight to Keep Auction Sellers Anonymous
